positive.review: personally much prefer XIII far than XIII Expansion,  5/5
Playing as an original officer and collecting different officers like they're pokemons is what makes this game the best in the ROTK franchise
personally much prefer XIII far than XIII Expansion,  5/5
Please give 1440p Res and fps unlock

negative.review: Used to love this game. But now with a new computer, this game always crashes on startup. Tried everything I can think of, nothing works.
boring and un-historical sandbox experience

If you never played the RotK series, don't bother getting this. Hopefully they'll finally give a sh*t about this series in the next release like they did with the new Dynasty Warriors game, I'm just getting milked by Koei at this point, paying premium for the same recycled content over and over again.
Used to love this game. But now with a new computer, this game always crashes on startup. Tried everything I can think of, nothing works.

The game *seem* fun to me, I'l definitely try to play this on something else - like a emulator or PS - but this PC version can't even play normally.
- Game keep on crashing (just silently shut down) while playing. I've only played 2 short tutorial scenarios but it already crashed twice forcing me to replay each one again.
- Max resolution is 1920x1080 so if you play borderless it'll be just a small panel on the screen

If you never played the RotK series, don't bother getting this. Hopefully they'll finally give a sh*t about this series in the next release like they did with the new Dynasty Warriors game, I'm just getting milked by Koei at this point, paying premium for the same recycled content over and over again.
boring and un-historical sandbox experience

ROTK vet here, been playing since I was in high school. 

This has a lot going for it, and a ton going against it. Short version...

The UI is probably the worst UI I have ever played with. For instance, the city names can get hidden (this is a huge deal when you have a mission to travel somewhere but you can't find the city names), and the button to turn them back on is called "Switch Ordinance Info"...seriously. 

The battle system is actually really well done, the only problem is that since reincforcements can join after the battle has been initiated, a single battle can last well over an hour. The "respect my time" isn't exactly there. 

I would not recommend purchasing this, go for 8 instead, by far one my favorite games of all time.

Hopefully they'll finally give a sh*t about this series in the next release like they did with the new Dynasty Warriors game, I'm just getting milked by Koei at this point, paying premium for the same recycled content over and over again.

boring and un-historical sandbox experience

ROTK vet here, been playing since I was in high school. 

This has a lot going for it, and a ton going against it. Short version...

The UI is probably the worst UI I have ever played with. For instance, the city names can get hidden (this is a huge deal when you have a mission to travel somewhere but you can't find the city names), and the button to turn them back on is called "Switch Ordinance Info"...seriously. 

The battle system is actually really well done, the only problem is that since reincforcements can join after the battle has been initiated, a single battle can last well over an hour. The "respect my time" isn't exactly there. 

I would not recommend purchasing this, go for 8 instead, by far one my favorite games of all time.
Used to love this game. But now with a new computer, this game always crashes on startup. Tried everything I can think of, nothing works.

The game *seem* fun to me, I'l definitely try to play this on something else - like a emulator or PS - but this PC version can't even play normally.
- Game keep on crashing (just silently shut down) while playing. I've only played 2 short tutorial scenarios but it already crashed twice forcing me to replay each one again.
- Max resolution is 1920x1080 so if you play borderless it'll be just a small panel on the screen

If you never played the RotK series, don't bother getting this. Hopefully they'll finally give a sh*t about this series in the next release like they did with the new Dynasty Warriors game, I'm just getting milked by Koei at this point, paying premium for the same recycled content over and over again.
boring and un-historical sandbox experience
